intro: Gymnosphaera metteniana, commonly known as the African silver tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its silver-gray, papery bark and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain seeds surrounded by a fleshy, orange-colored aril. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along riverbanks. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in local communities.
